alert.note: Alert for Athens (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 3:49AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Athens. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall and snowmelt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 346 AM EST, Rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches possible in the warned area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Glouster, Chauncey, Jacksonville and Trimble. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
